FRS_Method: GPS, WITH CANADIAN ACTIVE CONTROL SYSTEM

_accidents.CF_Other: Fan motor releases and strikes coil

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Rich Products



Rich Products prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system.  Wherever possible refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic). The facility maintains an ongoing emergency response program that prepares for safe evacuation and timely response by trained personnel.



2.0 Rich Products and Anhydrous Ammonia.



Rich Products Brunswick processes and cools appetizer products for national distribution. Approximately 45,000 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on site at Rich Products. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system. 



3.0  Accidental Release Prevention Program and Prevention Steps.



Rich Products complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) rule; OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER); OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Plans and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plans (RMP). 



Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of the ammonia refrigeration system include: microprocessors have been installed on all compressors to improve control and safety during a malfunction; ammonia system alarms are linked to the refrigeration office computer for improved monitoring. Security personnel are on site 24 hours, 7 days per week.



4.0  Five Year Accident History.



An ammonia release was reported in August 2007. The cause was a malfunctioning evapor

ator. There is a record of the ammonia release incident on file as part of the facility Process Safety Management Program.



5.0  Rich Products Emergency Response Program.



Rich Products maintains an ongoing emergency response program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies. The program includes initial and annual training for employees who respond to releases or potential releases. The program includes written procedures for proper first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat human exposures; procedures for using emergency response equipment and procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the local fire department and Local Emergency Planning Commission, as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act.



6.0  Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Rich Products.



Future plans to improve anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system safety at the Rich Products Brunswick facility include: continuing operator training, maintaining the emergency response training program; periodic Risk Management Program audits, and continuing management of the facility PSM program elements.
